alert.note: Alert for Coastal Del Norte; Mendocino Coast; Southwestern Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 20 at 11:00AM PST until January 21 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...Long Period Swell Moving in this Evening... .Long period forerunners will start filling in this afternoon. The wave size will be sufficient for sneaker waves by this evening. The swell will be near 8 feet at 18 seconds by early Saturday morning. Steep beaches will have a higher risk of sneaker wave activity with greater wave run-up onto beaches. Large waves will also wash over jetties and rock outcroppings that may normally stay dry. ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Large unexpected waves along the coast. * WHERE...Coastal Del Norte, Southwestern Humboldt, and Mendocino Coast. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Large, unexpected waves can sweep across the beach without warning, sweeping people into the sea from rocks, jetties, and beaches. These waves can also move large objects such as logs, crushing anyone caught underneath. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Don`t be fooled by an ocean that looks calm. There can be 30 minutes of small waves before a sneaker wave strikes. Avoid rocks and jetties. Avoid steep beaches. Stay much farther back from the water and never turn your back on the ocean.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Del Norte; Mendocino Coast; Southwestern Humboldt
